abstract.p: Library of Congress acquires personal papers of violinist Louis Kaufman (S)

block.p: The Library of Congress says it has acquired the personal papers of the violinist Louis Kaufman, including letters from such prominent musicians and artists as Leonard Bernstein, Aaron Copland and Milton Avery.

The museum said on Wednesday that the acquisition, a gift from the composer's widow, Annette, involved some 9,000 items. Kaufman, who died in 1994, recorded music for over 400 films, including ''Gone With the Wind,'' and won the Grand Prix du Disque in 1950 for his recording of Vivaldi's ''Four Seasons.''
